Award.AwardTitle: Nanoparticle transfer to oocytes-- Travel request to the 2012 CBET Grantee Conference, June 6-8, 2012, Baltimore, MD

Division.LongName: Div Of Chem, Bioeng, Env, & Transp Sys

Award.AbstractNarration: This award is for travel to and participation in the CBET grantees' meeting. The PI will present a poster updating current work.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The overall goal of this funding was to allow Dr. Nancy Denslow (PI) to attend the NSF CBET Grantee Conference in Baltimore, MD, June of 2012.  

 

Intellectual Merit:  Dr. Denslow was able to give an oral presentation at the conference on her research on the uptake of nanomaterials in fish and receive back criticisms and questions from the other attendees that have helped her build a better research program in nanomaterials.   She was also able to hear summaries of other research groups and from this she got additional cutting edge information that has helped her with her research program. 

Denslow, ND, Nanoparticle transport to oocytes and toxicologic consequences in fathead minnow, Platform presentation Annual NSF Grantees Meeting, Baltimore, Md, June 6-8, 2012, platform presentation.

Broader Impacts:  The NSF CBET Grantee Conference provided an excellent opportunity for networking with other scientists and also allowed us to talk with Program Directors and better understand how NSF functions and also about all of the possible NSF/CBET programs that are available.  It was most interesting to get this information.  It was also an opportunity for Program Directors to interact with Dr. Denslow.   The discussions that came out of the conference have enabled new collaborations. 


Last Modified: 04/25/2013
Modified by: Nancy D Denslow
